item.title: Simple Notes of My Attendance ICLR2021
item.description:
In ICLR2021, I found some interesting papers and presentations and collect their posters with my ideas as follows:

Name Tags Summary&Idea
Sparse Quantized Spectral Clustering spectral clustering useful study
Representation learning for sequence data with deep autoencoding predictive comments autoencoder, deep learning
Scalable Learning and MAP Inference for Nonsymmetric Determinantal Point Processes kernel decomposition
MiCE- Mixture of Contrastive Experts for Unsupervised Image Clustering moco, unsupervised image clustering
Simple Spectral Graph Convolution MARKOV DIFFUSION KERNEL
Deep Learning meets Projective Clustering deep learning, svd Model compression with decomposed SVD, but pre-cluster
Evaluation of Similarity-based Explanations criteria to evaluate Evaluate with the closest sample, whether the closest sample is a category or not a category
Self-supervised Learning from a Multi-view Perspective multi-view Define pre-order and post-order objective functions and then balance and optimize them
Clustering-friendly Representation Learning via Instance Discrimination and Feature Decorrelation deep learning, spectral clustering, unsupervised image clustering This is a study at Toshiba Research Institute, related to spectral clustering. It’s interesting. I can do image clustering in the future.
Evaluation of Similarity-based Explanations image, similarity Can refer to him and see how he calculates the similairty of the image
SAFENet: A Secure, Accurate and Fast Neural Network Inference privacy Gradient Privacy
Do not Let Privacy Overbill Utility: Gradient Embedding Perturbation for Private Learning privacy Gradient Privacy
Information Laundering for Model Privacy privacy Model Privacy
